meanings.sent1: The overplotting book had so many details that it was hard to keep track of.
meanings.sent2: The overplotting movie had too many twists and turns for the audience to follow.
meanings.sent3: The detective's overplotting of clues made the case seem like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her overplotting mind was like a tangled web of intricate ideas.
meanings.sent5: The overplotting description painted a vivid picture of the scene.

meanings.definition: The act of creating too many plot elements in a story
meanings.sent1: The overplotting in the novel made it confusing for readers to follow the story.
meanings.sent2: The overplotting in the screenplay resulted in a convoluted and messy film.
meanings.sent3: The overplotting in the play turned the simple story into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The overplotting of characters in the series made it hard to keep track of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The overplotting of events in the story created a whirlwind of confusion for the audience.
